loadingErrorMsg: There was an error when loading the project.
selectSceneMsg: Select a Scene in the Project to Start
savingErrorMsg: There was an error when saving the project.
savingSceneErrorMsg: Scene is not loaded properly. Try reloading the scene.
exportingErrorMsg: There was an error when exporting the project.
importLegacyMsg: Warning! This will overwrite your existing scene! Are you sure you wish to continue?

errors.fileTypeNotSupported: Unsupported file type for file: "{{name}}". File must be an image, video, or glb model.
errors.removeObject: removeObject: node not found. This is due to removing a node that is no longer in the scene.
errors.noParent: {{node}} "{{name}}" has no parent. Reparent only works on objects that are currently in the scene.
errors.unsavedChangesMsg: The scene has been modified. Please save your changes.
errors.sceneTooLarge: Scene is too large ({{size}} MB) to publish. Maximum size is {{maxSize}} MB.

transformSpace.description: Sets your transform control to be oriented to the object(selection) or world
transformSpace.info-world: World space relates to the entire sceneâ€™s orientation
transformSpace.info-selection: Object Space (your selection) relates to transforms made to a specific object in relationship to the world space

transformPivot.info-selection: The center pivot of the final asset you selected in the sequence.
transformPivot.info-center: A pivot that sits at an equal distance between all selections.
transformPivot.info-bottom: A pivot that sits equally between all selections and at the bottom of your final selection in the sequence.
transformPivot.info-origin: Sets pivot mode to the world origin (0,0,0)

transformSnapTool.info-translate: Translate objects by a unit of measurement.
transformSnapTool.info-rotate: Rotate objects by a specific degrees.

render-settings.info: How you view materials in the Engine

stats.info: Show stats about the scene and gives you a clue as to how optimized your scene is.

helpersToggle.info-helpers: View hidden information about your scene, ie: colliders
helpersToggle.info-nodeHelpers: Helper geometry that helps components have visibility in the scene when inactive.

sceneScreenshot.info: Takes a screenshot of your scene at the current view.

publishLocation.title: Publish
publishLocation.info: Publish location for the selected scene.

properties.title: Properties
properties.info: Propeties let you access and edit detailed information about objects in the scene.
properties.multipleNodeSelected: Multiple Nodes of different types selected

ambientLight.name: Ambient Light
ambientLight.description: A light which illuminates all objects in your scene.

prefab.name: Prefab
prefab.description: A grouping of scene components which can be dynamically loaded and unloaded

persistent-anchor.name: Persistent Anchor
persistent-anchor.description: Anchors this entity to a real life reference

media.name: Media
media.info-controls: Toggle the visibility of the media controls.
media.info-synchronize: If true, the media will be synchronized on all the connected clients.

mesh.name: Mesh
mesh.description: A mesh is a collection of vertices, edges, and faces that describe the shape of a 3D object.

materialProperties.title: Material
materialProperties.info: Access and edit detailed information about materials in the scene.

audio.name: Positional Audio
audio.info-distanceModel: The algorithim used to calculate audio rolloff.
audio.info-rolloffFactor: A double value describing how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener. 0 to 1
audio.info-rfInfinity: A double value describing how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener. 0 to Infinity
audio.info-refDistance: A double value representing the reference distance for reducing volume as the audio source moves further from the listener.
audio.info-maxDistance: A double value representing the maximum distance between the audio source and the listener, after which the volume is not reduced any further.
audio.info-coneInnerAngle: A double value describing the angle, in degrees, of a cone inside of which there will be no volume reduction.
audio.info-coneOuterAngle: A double value describing the angle, in degrees, of a cone outside of which the volume will be reduced by a constant value, defined by the coneOuterGain attribute.
audio.info-coreOuterGain: A double value describing the amount of volume reduction outside the cone defined by the coneOuterAngle attribute. Its default value is 0, meaning that no sound can be heard.

collider.name: Collider
collider.description:
An invisible box that objects will bounce off of or rest on top of.
Without colliders, objects will fall through floors and go through walls.

directionalLight.name: Directional Light
directionalLight.description: A light which illuminates the entire scene, but emits along a single direction.

groundPlane.name: Ground Plane
groundPlane.description: A flat ground plane that extends into the distance.
groundPlane.info-visible: Toggle the visibility of the ground plane. Setting to false will still allow shadows to be received, rather than setting the entity visibility.

loopAnimation.title: Loop Animation
loopAnimation.description: Looped animation associated with your 3d model, loaded from a GLTF URL or file.

variant.name: Variant
variant.description: Load different assets based on heuristics

map.description: 3D geospatial map of e.g. a city.

model.title: Model
model.description: A 3D model in your scene, loaded from a GLTF URL or file.

transform.flipYTooltip: If checked, the source images will be Y flipped before compression
transform.srgbTooltip: If checked, the provided map is assumed to be in sRGB space
transform.qualityTooltip: Sets the ETC1S encoder's quality level, which controls the file size vs. quality tradeoff
transform.modeTooltip: If checked, the encoder will output a UASTC texture, otherwise a ETC1S texture
transform.mipmapsTooltip: If checked, the encoder will generate mipmaps
transform.compressionLevelTooltip: The compression level parameter controls the encoder perf vs. file size tradeoff for ETC1S files. It does not directly control file size vs. quality (see Quality)
transform.uastcFlagsTooltip: Sets the UASTC encoding performance vs. quality tradeoff, and other lesser used UASTC encoder flags. This is a combination of flags
transform.normalMapTooltip: Tunes several codec parameters so compression works better on normal maps

group.name: Group
group.description:
A group of multiple objects that can be moved or duplicated together.
Drag and drop objects into the Group in the Hierarchy.

hemisphere.name: Hemisphere Light
hemisphere.description: A light which illuminates the scene from directly overhead.

image.name: Image
image.info-controls: Toggle the visibility of the media controls.
image.info-mask: 'mask' = Use a specified cutoff value for on/off transparency (more performant)
image.info-alphaCutoff: Pixels with alpha values lower than this will be transparent

screenshare.name: Screenshare Target
screenshare.description: Allows this object to be a target for screen-share projection.

ocean.name: Ocean
ocean.description: Ocean surface with waves and foam

interior.name: Interior
interior.description: A surface with mapped cube texture to emulate interior environments

pointLight.description: A light which emits in all directions from a single point.

instancing.name: Instancing
instancing.description: Generates instanced geometry according to input

cameraSettings.name: Camera
cameraSettings.description: Change the camera settings for this scene.

postprocessing.name: Post Processing
postprocessing.description: For applying Post Processing effects to you scene.

mediaSettings.name: Media Settings
mediaSettings.info-avatarDistanceModel: The algorithim used to calculate audio rolloff.
mediaSettings.info-avatarRolloffFactor: A double value describing how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener. 0 to 1
mediaSettings.info-avatarRolloffFactorInifinity: A double value describing how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener. 0 to Infinity
mediaSettings.info-avatarRefDistance: A double value representing the reference distance for reducing volume as the audio source moves further from the listener.
mediaSettings.info-avatarMaxDistance: A double value representing the maximum distance between the audio source and the listener, after which the volume is not reduced any further.
mediaSettings.info-mediaDistanceModel: The algorithim used to calculate audio rolloff.
mediaSettings.info-immersiveMedia: Enable immersive media for non-immersive platforms.
mediaSettings.info-mediaRolloffFactor: A double value describing how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener. 0 to 1
mediaSettings.info-mediaRolloffFactorInfinity: A double value describing how quickly the volume is reduced as the source moves away from the listener. 0 to Infinity
mediaSettings.info-mediaRefDistance: A double value representing the reference distance for reducing volume as the audio source moves further from the listener.
mediaSettings.info-mediaMaxDistance: A double value representing the maximum distance between the audio source and the listener, after which the volume is not reduced any further.
mediaSettings.info-mediaConeInnerAngle: A double value describing the angle, in degrees, of a cone inside of which there will be no volume reduction.
mediaSettings.info-mediaConeOuterAngle: A double value describing the angle, in degrees, of a cone outside of which the volume will be reduced by a constant value, defined by the coneOuterGain attribute.
mediaSettings.info-mediaConeOuterGain: A double value describing the amount of volume reduction outside the cone defined by the coneOuterAngle attribute. Its default value is 0, meaning that no sound can be heard.

renderSettings.name: Render Settings
renderSettings.info-lods: Sets the distances at which levels of detail change.
renderSettings.info-csm-cascades: Smaller the size of the scene. More efficient to have less cascades.
renderSettings.info-toneMapping: Enables tone mapping on the scene renderer. Has no effect when a post processing is enabled.
renderSettings.info-toneMappingExposure: Specifies the tone mapping exposure on the scene renderer. Has no effect when a post processing is enabled.

scene.name: Scene
scene.description: The root object of the scene.

sceneCamera.name: Scene Preview Camera
sceneCamera.description: The camera used to generate the thumbnail for your scene and the starting position for the preview camera.

spawnPoint.name: Spawn Point
spawnPoint.description:
A point where people will appear when they enter your scene.
The icon in the Viewport represents the actual size of an avatar.

linkComp.title: link Component
linkComp.description: Adds an interactable that opens links or navigates scene

spotLight.description: A light which emits along a direction, illuminating objects within a cone.

triggerVolume.description: Sets a property on the target object on enter and leave.

video.name: Video
video.lbl-size-info: The dimensions of the surface on which the video will be presented
video.lbl-fit-info: How the video should be stretched within the given canvas size
video.lbl-media-info: An entity w/ a media component that should be sourced for display

splinetrack.name: Spline Track
splinetrack.description: Have an entity follow a Spline

portal.description: A Portal to teleport players to specified location

mountPoint.name: Mount point
mountPoint.description: An object with a pose to define interactable behaviors.

page.headerMsg: If you're new here we recommend going through the tutorial. Otherwise, jump right in and create a project from scratch or from one of our templates.

component-detail.gltf-model: Creates objects in the hierarchy. Drag a model from the assets folder into the URL box or drag assets directly from project files into the hierarchy.
component-detail.volumetric: Import volumetric files. Accepts DRCS, UVOL, or Manifest Files. Links to cloud hosting.
component-detail.variant: Add model variant for level of detail
component-detail.image: Imports an image into the scene
component-detail.collider: Creates a collision ball, cuboid, capsule, or cylinder to be manually placement.
component-detail.spawn-point: A point where people will appear when they enter your scene.
component-detail.portal: A portal to teleport a player to a port in a different location.
component-detail.ambient-light: A combination of direct and indirect light, provides general lighting to all assets.
component-detail.point-light: A light which emits in all directions from a single point.
component-detail.spot-light: Creates a light that shines in a specific direction.
component-detail.directional-light: Creates a light that emits evenly in a single direction.
component-detail.hemisphere-light: A light which illuminates the scene from directly overhead.
component-detail.system: Inserts code into the scene by creating a new Entity Component System based on the provided .ts file
component-detail.BehaveGraph: Customizes state and behavior of entities through a node graph connection.
component-detail.envmapbake: Add Env Mapbake to your scene.
component-detail.scene-preview-camera: A preview camera which generates a scene thumbnail and the starting position.
component-detail.skybox: Sets the area outside your map (skybox) with a specific sky type.
component-detail.envmap: Add environment map to your scene
component-detail.postprocessing: Add postprocessing effects to your scene
component-detail.primitive-geometry: Add basic Geometry to the scene
component-detail.link: Add clickable Link to entity to route to different webpage

hierarchy.info: The scene Hierarchy contains all element currently in your scene (assets, lighting, items from the tool menu, etc).

materialLibrary.info: Location of an assets materials and where you can select and edit them.

performance.title: Performance Check
performance.info-polycount: We recommend your scene use no more than 50,000 triangles for mobile devices.
performance.info-material: We recommend using no more than 25 unique materials in your scene to reduce draw calls on mobile devices.
performance.info-texture: We recommend your textures use no more than 256MB of video RAM for mobile devices. We also recommend against using textures larger than 2048 x 2048.
performance.info-lights: While dynamic lights are not enabled on mobile devices, we recommend using no more than 3 lights in your scene (excluding ambient and hemisphere lights) for your scene to run on low end PCs.
performance.info-fileSize: We recommend a final file size of no more than 16MB for low bandwidth connections. Reducing the file size will reduce the time it takes to download your scene.

publish.title: Publish Scene
publish.info-name: Name must be between 4 and 64 characters and cannot contain underscores

saveNewScene.title: Save As
saveNewScene.info-name: Name must be between 4 and 64 characters and cannot contain underscores

support.title: Support
support.msg: You can file a <1>GitHub Issue</1> or e-mail us for support at <3>{{mail}}</3>
support.discord: You can also find us on <1>Discord</1>

delete.not-allowed-local-dev: To prevent accidental loss of data, projects cannot be deleted from this menu in a local dev environment. Use the file system instead.

useUpload.multipleFileError: Input does not accept multiple files.
useUpload.mineTypeError: "{{name}}" does not match the following mime types or extensions: {{types}}

openLink.description: Please click the Open to navigate to the link.
